Utterance: <synch>
Hi, it's great to see you again! How have you been since our last session?
Hi Ellie! I've been doing well, thanks for asking. Just keeping busy with work and family.
That's good to hear! Last time, you mentioned feeling good overall but having some rough patches with your son and daughter. How has that been for you lately?
It's been a bit of a rollercoaster. My daughter is still navigating her teenage years, and sometimes we clash. But I think we're finding our rhythm.
That sounds promising. Can you tell me more about a recent interaction you had with her?
Sure! Just the other day, she wanted to go out with friends, and I felt she wasn't being responsible about it. We had a bit of a disagreement, but I tried to listen to her perspective.
How did that conversation go?
It was tough at first. I was worried she wasn't being safe. But once I calmed down and listened, I realized she just wanted some independence. We ended up reaching a compromise.
That's a great approach! It sounds like you were able to validate her feelings while still expressing your concerns.
Yes, exactly! I felt proud of how we handled it.
That’s wonderful. How did you feel after the conversation?
I felt relieved and proud. It was a good reminder that communication is key, even when emotions run high.
Absolutely! It sounds like you're making progress in your relationship with her. What about your son? Have you had any updates there?
Well, he's still a bit distant. I’ve been trying to give him space, but sometimes I wish he would reach out more.
That’s understandable. It can be hard to watch your child pull away. Have you considered any ways to reconnect with him?
I think I might try inviting him over for dinner. Just the two of us. I want him to know I'm here for him without pressure.
That sounds like a lovely idea! It could provide a relaxed environment for both of you to connect. How do you feel about initiating that?
A bit nervous, to be honest. What if he declines again?
It's natural to feel that way. Remember, it's about creating the opportunity, not forcing it. If he declines, it doesn't reflect your worth as a parent.
That’s true. I need to remind myself of that.
Yes, and you can always express that you’re there when he’s ready. It shows him that you care.
I will definitely keep that in mind.
Great! Now, shifting gears a bit, how have you been managing your own self-care amidst all this?
I’ve been trying to carve out some time for myself. I’ve picked up yoga again, and it's been refreshing.
That sounds wonderful! Yoga can be a great way to center yourself. How does it make you feel?
It really helps me clear my mind and find some peace. I feel more in control afterward.
It's fantastic that you have found something that works for you. Have you noticed any changes in your mood or stress levels since you started practicing?
Definitely! I feel less anxious and more grounded. It’s like a reset button for me.
That’s a powerful tool to have! Would you like to set any specific self-care goals for the next few weeks?
Maybe I could aim for three yoga sessions a week. That feels manageable.
That sounds like a great plan! How about we check in on that goal in our next session?
Yes, I’d like that.
Perfect! Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think that covers it for now. Just feeling a bit more hopeful about my relationships.
I’m glad to hear that! Remember, it’s all about progress, not perfection.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome! I look forward to hearing about your yoga practice and your dinner invitation next time.
Me too!
Take care, and see you soon!
Bye!
